definition: to advance gradually and entrench oneself at every step/to consolidate at every step
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
surname Bu
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: But he has enough to do, as both companies are on the defensive.
sentences.chinese: 但是，这两家公司都步步为营，戈恩无法有大的举动。

sentences.english: We must maintain calm and go from game to game.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须保持冷静，步步为营。

sentences.english: We battled back bit by bit and had a little luck on the way.
sentences.chinese: 我们耐心地步步为营进行反击并拥有点儿好运气。

sentences.english: Sony Ericsson would follow Nokia's tactic of slowly building up to a full-on Web services push.
sentences.chinese: 索爱将学习并跟随诺基亚步步为营的WEB服务战略。

definition: to go steady and strike hard (in fighting)/fig. steadily and surely
step by step/at every step
to work out a strategy/to come up with a plan for
to advance prematurely
lit. as if walking on thin ice (idiom)/fig. to be extremely cautious/to be skating on thin ice
lit. to devise battle plan in a tent (idiom)/fig. planning strategies
to conceal one's strengths and bide one's time (idiom)/to hide one's light under a bushel
cautious and timid (idiom); prudent/careful
to win by a surprise move
lit. deep plans and distant thoughts/to plan far ahead (idiom)
closely linked with one another/interlocked/to interrelate
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
free to come and go (idiom)/to have room to maneuver
to counter every move/to be full of tricks
danger lurks on every side (idiom)
lit. to have accumulated knowledge and deliver it slowly (idiom)/good preparation is the key to success/to be well prepared
